# insertTabViewItem(_:at:)

**Instance Method**

Inserts a tab view into the tab view controller’s list of tabs.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func insertTabViewItem(_ tabViewItem: NSTabViewItem, at index: Int)
```

## Parameters

- **tabViewItem**: The tab view item to insert. The tab view item must have an associated view controller. If this parameter is `nil` or if the tab view item does not have a view controller, this method throws an exception.
- **index**: The zero-based index at which to insert the tab. If the index is less than `0` or greater than the number of items currently in the array, this method raises an exception.

## Discussion

Use this method to insert new tabs into the existing list of tabs. This method adds the tab’s associated view controller as a child of the tab view controller, so you do not need to call the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/addChild(_:)] method directly. The view for the new view controller is not loaded until its corresponding tab is selected by the user.

Inserting a new tab updates the tab view interface and adjusts the value in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabViewController/selectedTabViewItemIndex] property as needed.

If you override this method, you must call `super` at some point in your implementation.

## Managing Tab View Items

- **tabViewItems**: The array of tab view items used to manage each of the child view controllers.
- **tabViewItem(for:)**: Returns the tab view item for the specified child view controller.
- **addTabViewItem(_:)**: Adds the specified tab to the end of the tab view controller’s list of tabs.
- **removeTabViewItem(_:)**: Removes the specified tab view item from the tab view controller.
- **selectedTabViewItemIndex**: The index of the selected tab.
